key_points: A student, William Chavis Raynard Miller Jr., was killed in a school shooting at Mount Tabor High School, Winston-Salem, N.C.
The community showed strong support with donations and a vigil for the victim's family.
The suspected shooter was arrested around 6 p.m. on the day of the shooting.
Forsyth County District Attorney hinted the shooting might be gang-related.
Gov. Roy Cooper and local officials emphasized the importance of student safety and community support.
The incident marked the second school shooting in North Carolina in the same week.
Officials highlight the accessibility of guns as a significant issue.
The victim's mother urged parents to tell their children to put their guns down, calling the violence senseless.
There were two school resource officers on site when the shooting occurred, illustrating the need for security in schools.
The community is rallying together, with efforts to support the victim's family and a focus on student safety and the necessity of in-person learning amidst ongoing societal challenges.
spokespersons: Ed Weiss (Principal, Mount Tabor High School)
Rick Anderson (Coach and Teacher, Mount Tabor High School)
